summary: Jerome A. Cullings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list his name, salary, and pay during that period, indicating his involvement in the committee's work during that time. The documents do not specify his exact role within the SCAS, but his presence on the payroll suggests he held an administrative or support position.
significance: Jerome A. Cullings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While his specific role is not detailed, his presence in payroll records confirms his involvement in the committee's operations during a portion of its investigation.
